As an AI language model, I can provide numerous examples of innovative community-engagement initiatives taken by educational institutions. Here are a few:

1. The University of Pennsylvania's Center for High Impact Philanthropy has developed an innovative toolkit for measuring the social impact of investments. This toolkit has been used to evaluate the effectiveness of various philanthropic efforts, enabling donors and foundations to make more informed decisions and maximize their impact.

2. The University of Michigan's Poverty Solutions initiative has taken an interdisciplinary approach to addressing poverty in the state. The program brings together faculty, students, policymakers, and community groups to develop solutions that are grounded in research and tailored to local needs.

3. The University of British Columbia's Community-Engaged Research initiative connects faculty and students with community organizations to conduct research that addresses real-world problems. This approach not only fosters better relationships between the university and the community but also produces research that is more relevant and impactful.

4. The University of Maine's Sustainable Ecological Aquaculture Network has developed an innovative system for growing seaweed that supports local businesses and reduces the environmental impact of aquaculture. The program has the dual benefit of creating jobs while also contributing to environmental sustainability.

5. The University of Cape Town's Hasso Plattner Institute of Design Thinking has developed an innovative approach to problem-solving that emphasizes empathy and collaboration. The program brings together students from various disciplines to work on real-world problems and prototype innovative solutions.

These are just a few examples of the many innovative initiatives being undertaken by educational institutions to engage with their local communities and drive positive social and economic change.
